name: Safety Legislation, Regulations, and Industry Policy in The Trades

questions.question: What Part and Section of the OHS Code describes the code of practice for working in confined spaces?
What Part and Section of the OHS Code describes the use of a full body harness?
Section 217.1 states that infractions could result in criminal charges under the Criminal Code of Canada.
The Workers Compensation Board is a government funded profit-based corporation.
What are the three elements of fire often present in the workplace?
Employers must report accidents to the WCB within _____ hours of the incident.
What are the four categories of workplace hazards?
According to OHS, what control provides the highest level of worker protection?
How long are employers expected to retain first aid and incident reports?
What are the first aid requirements for low hazard work at a close work site with five to nine workers at the work site per shift?
options: One emergency first aider, one standard first aider, No. 2 first and kit, three blankets
Two standard first aiders, No. 2 first aid kit, three blankets
Two standard first aiders, No. 3 first aid kit, three blankets, stretcher, splint
One emergency first aider, one standard first aider, No. 2 first aid kit
correctAnswer: One emergency first aider, one standard first aider, No. 2 first aid kit

questions.question: OHS classifies a work site as 'isolated' if it is located more than ____ minutes from a health care facility.
Who is responsible to ensure that a worker uses PPE at the worksite?
Who is responsible to ensure work site emergency response plans remain up to date?
At what decibel level does hearing protection become mandatory?
When a work site hazard assessment identifies that workers are required to wear PPE what is your employer’s responsibility?
options: Ensure all workers are informed about the need to wear PPE.
Ensure all workers properly use and wear the required PPE.
Put up posters indicating a hazard assessment has identified that PPE is required.
Ensure all workers are provided with funding to purchase required PPE.
correctAnswer: Ensure all workers properly use and wear the required PPE.

questions.question: What is a characteristic of protective footwear with a yellow triangle on the outer side or tongue of the right shoe?
options: Sole puncture protection and Grade 2 protective toe (will withstand impact up to 90 Joules)
Soles that provide electrical shock protection and a Grade 2 protective toe (will withstand impact up to 90 Joules)
Sole puncture protection and Grade 1 protective toe (will withstand impact up to 125 Joules)
Soles that provide electrical shock protection and a Grade 1 protective toe (will withstand impact up to 125 Joules)
correctAnswer: Sole puncture protection and Grade 2 protective toe (will withstand impact up to 90 Joules)

questions.question: Which class of industrial safety headwear provides the best protection from electrical shock in addition to impact and penetration resistance?
What Part and Section of the OHS Code describes the membership of a joint worksite health and safety committee?
What Part and Section of the OHS Code describes the requirements and options for protective footwear?
What Part and Section of the OHS Code describes the requirements for worker training about WHMIS?
What is an employer responsibility regarding hazard assessment at the work site?
options: To provide easy and immediate access for any worker to the OHS Act, Regulation and Code at the work site
To ensure suppliers are aware of their responsibility to provide necessary information on any hazards related to their products
To develop a plan to eliminate or control any hazard identified at the work site
To ensure all workers participate in daily meetings to inspect their tools and plan their work
correctAnswer: To develop a plan to eliminate or control any hazard identified at the work site

questions.question: How is the Workers’ Compensation Board of Alberta funded?
options: 100% of the funding for the WCB comes from employers in Alberta.
75% of the funding for the WCB comes from employers and 25% comes from the provincial government.
50% of the funding for the WCB comes from employers, 25% from the provincial government and 25% from employees.
33% of the funding for the WCB comes from employers, 34% from the provincial government and 33% from employees.
correctAnswer: 100% of the funding for the WCB comes from employers in Alberta.

questions.question: What is an example of an engineering control for worker protection?
When is an administrative control put in place for worker protection?
options: To identify the correct personal protective equipment to be used in a hazardous situation
To document the details of the implementation of an engineering control
When an engineering control cannot eliminate or control a hazard
To isolate a hazard through containment or enclosure
correctAnswer: When an engineering control cannot eliminate or control a hazard

questions.question: Who is responsible to have an emergency response plan in place at the work site?
options: Joint work site health and safety committee

questions.question: What part of the OHS Code covers first aid requirements at the work site?
What must your employer do if first aid supplies are stored in secure containers at the work site?
options: Ensure the containers are clearly marked to indicate their contents.
Ensure the containers are stored in a dust proof environment.
Ensure the containers are not stacked more than 3 layers high.
Ensure the containers are inspected monthly to ensure contents are safe.
correctAnswer: Ensure the containers are clearly marked to indicate their contents.

questions.question: What number and type of first aiders must your employer ensure are present at an isolated work site with low hazard assessment rating and 65 workers at the work site per shift?
options: One Standard First Aider and one Emergency First Aider
Two Standard First Aiders and one Emergency First Aider

questions.question: What is the duty to use personal protective equipment according to the Alberta OHS Code?
options: A clause that must be included in the employment contract of every construction worker in Alberta
A sign that must be posted at the entrance to any work site where PPE is required
The part of the OHS Code that describes the different types of PPE to be used on the work site
What you and your employer must do if a hazard assessment identifies the need for the use of PPE
correctAnswer: What you and your employer must do if a hazard assessment identifies the need for the use of PPE

questions.question: When a work site hazard assessment identifies that workers are required to wear PPE, what is your employer’s responsibility?
options: Ensure all workers are informed about the need to wear PPE.
Ensure all workers properly use and wear the required PPE.
Put up posters indicating a hazard assessment has identified that PPE is required.
Ensure all workers are provided with funding to purchase required PPE.
correctAnswer: Ensure all workers properly use and wear the required PPE.

questions.question: What is an employee responsibility with regard to the use of PPE?
options: To inspect your PPE once a month
To modify poor fitting PPE so it fits properly
To inspect your PPE prior to each use
To wear your PPE only when you sense an accident may happen
correctAnswer: To inspect your PPE prior to each use

questions.question: Industrial protective headwear must comply with what standard?
What is not an obligation your employer assumes when a hazard assessment indicates the need for PPE?
options: To post a Duty to Use Personal Protective Equipment sign at all entrances to the worksite
To ensure employees are trained in the use, care, limitations, and maintenance of their PPE
To ensure workers properly use and wear PPE
To ensure the PPE is in a condition to perform the function intended
correctAnswer: To post a Duty to Use Personal Protective Equipment sign at all entrances to the worksite

questions.question: In what situation is your employer obligated to provide you with proper PPE according the OHS Code?
options: When required PPE must be replaced more frequently than once a year
When required PPE must be replaced more frequently than once every 2 years
When workers are exposed to respiratory hazard or excessive noise levels
When workers are exposed to respiratory hazards only
correctAnswer: When workers are exposed to respiratory hazard or excessive noise levels
